About Us

We are a 5-person, first-year FTC team in San Mateo, California with an intense passion for robotics. Our team is fully student-run, meaning that students handle the design and building of the robot as well as our finances and logistics.

We value simplicity and iterative design as our core design principles, aiming to have a working robot before every competition.

Our Team

Alton Olson Team Captain

Alton has 2 years of experience in both FRC and FTC. This year, he switched to FTC only and helped start Vulcan back in May 2014. He is excited to have a working robot for our rookie year!

Justin Lee Mechanical

Former FLL, FTC, and FRC team member, Justin transferred from another robotics team to help start Vulcan this season. Justin is heavily involved in all the moving parts of the robot.

Horace He Programming

Horace has experience in competitive programming, competing in contests such as USACO Gold and Stanford ProCo. This is his first year on a robotics team, and he is excited to write, test, and debug our robot's code.

Josh Pollock Electrical

In his first year on a robotics team, Josh has designed the electrical system on the robot and helped with organization and logistics.

Louis Villa Public Relations

Louis, one of the team's founding members, has completed two years of FLL and one year of FRC. Last summer, he interned with a mechanical engineer in the 3D printing industry.
